required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of IMCnyeso in Advanced NY-ESO-1 and/or LAGE-1A Positive Cancers
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I/II Study of IMCnyeso, HLA- A*0201-Restricted, NY-ESO-1- and LAGE-1A-specific Soluble T Cell Receptor and Anti-CD3 Bispecific Molecule, in HLA-A*0201 Positive Patients With Advanced NY-ESO-1 and/or LAGE - 1A Positive Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: IMCnyeso is a new biological therapy designed for the treatment of cancers which express NY-ESO-1 and/or LAGE-1A. This is a first-in-human trial designed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of IMCnyeso in adult patients who have the appropriate HLA-A2 tissue marker and whose cancer is positive for NY-ESO-1 and/or LAGE-A1.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a multi-center, open label, dose finding Phase 1/2 study of single agent IMCnyeso administered in patients with NY-ESO-1 and/or LAGE-A1 positive tumors. The primary objective of the dose escalation phase (Arm 1) is to determine the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) and/or recommended Phase II dose (RP2D) of IMCnyeso in patients with advanced solid tumors. Preliminary efficacy will be evaluated in Arm 2.

primary_outcome.measure: Phase I: Incidence of dose-limiting toxicities (DLT)
primary_outcome.time_frame: from first dose to end of DLT period (up until Day 28 after first dose)

primary_outcome.measure: Phase I: incidence and severity of adverse events (AE)
primary_outcome.time_frame: from first dose to 30 days after the last dose

primary_outcome.measure: Phase I: changes in laboratory parameters
primary_outcome.time_frame: from first dose to 30 days after the last dose
primary_outcome.description: Abnormalities will be classified according to NCI CTCAE version 4.03

primary_outcome.measure: Phase I: changes in body temperature
primary_outcome.time_frame: from first dose to 30 days after the last dose
primary_outcome.description: Body temperature will be measured throughout the study. Both absolute values and changes from Baseline will be reported.

primary_outcome.time_frame: from first dose to 30 days after the last dose
primary_outcome.description: Pulse will be measured throughout the study. Both absolute values and changes from Baseline will be reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Phase I: changes in respiratory rate
primary_outcome.time_frame: from first dose to 30 days after the last dose
primary_outcome.description: Respiratory rate will be measured throughout the study. Both absolute values and changes from Baseline will be reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Phase I: changes in blood pressure
primary_outcome.time_frame: from first dose to 30 days after the last dose
primary_outcome.description: Blood pressure will be measured throughout the study. Both absolute values and changes from Baseline will be reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Phase I: changes in electrocardiogram parameters
primary_outcome.time_frame: from first dose to 30 days after the last dose
primary_outcome.description: QTcF interval absolute values and changes from Baseline

primary_outcome.measure: Phase I: dose interruptions, reductions, and discontinuations
primary_outcome.time_frame: from first dose through last dose (anticipated up to 1 year)
primary_outcome.description: Tolerability of study treatment will be assessed by summarizing the number of treatment dose interruptions and dose reductions.

primary_outcome.time_frame: from first dose to approximately 2 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: changes in laboratory parameters

secondary_outcome.description: Abnormalities will be classified according to NCI CTCAE version 4.03

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: changes in respiratory rate
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from first dose to 30 days after the last dose
secondary_outcome.description: Respiratory rate will be measured throughout the study. Both absolute values and changes from Baseline will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: changes in blood pressure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from first dose to 30 days after the last dose
secondary_outcome.description: Blood pressure will be measured throughout the study. Both absolute values and changes from Baseline will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: changes in electrocardiogram parameters
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from first dose to 30 days after the last dose
secondary_outcome.description: QTcF interval absolute values and changes from Baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: dose interruptions, reductions, and discontinuations
secondary_outcome.time_frame: first dose through last dose (anticipated up to 1 year)
secondary_outcome.description: Tolerability of study treatment will be assessed by summarizing the number of treatment dose interruptions and dose reductions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics Area under the plasma concentration-time curve (AUC)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 weeks (AUC will be assessed weekly for 2 weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics The maximum observed plasma drug concentration after single dose administration (Cmax)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 weeks (AUC will be assessed weekly for 2 weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics The time to reach maximum plasma concentration (Tmax)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 weeks (AUC will be assessed weekly for 2 weeks)
2 weeks (AUC will be assessed weekly for 2 weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Immunogenicity the incidence of anti-IMCnyeso antibody formation Immunogenicity the incidence of anti-IMCnyeso antibody formation

arm_group.arm_group_label: IMCnyeso dose Escalation Phase with approximately 4-10 cohorts
arm_group.description: Phase (Arm 1) n=approximately 27 patients to establish the MTD/RP2D
n=9-24/cohort treated at the RP2D to make a preliminary assessment of the anti-tumor activity of IMCnyeso

intervention.arm_group_label: IMCnyeso dose Escalation Phase with approximately 4-10 cohorts

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. HLA-A*0201 positive
2. NY-ESO-1 and/or LAGE-1A positive tumor
3. ECOG PS 0 or 1
4. Selected advanced solid tumors
5. Relapsed from, refractory to, or intolerant of standard therapy
6. Measurable disease per RECIST v1.1
7. If applicable, must agree to use highly effective contraception
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Symptomatic or untreated central nervous system metastasis
2. Inadequate washout from prior anticancer therapy
3. Significant ongoing toxicity from prior anticancer treatment
4. Impaired baseline organ function as evaluated by out-of-range laboratory values
5. Clinically significant cardiac disease
6. Active infection requiring systemic antibiotic therapy
7. Known history of human immunodeficiency virus (HIV)
8. Active hepatitis B virus (HBV) or hepatitis C virus (HCV)
9. Ongoing treatment with systemic steroids or other immunosuppressive therapies
10. Significant secondary malignancy
11. Pregnancy or lactation
